data_maturity_score.evidence: Traditional utility company with focus on regulatory compliance, PowerBI/SQL stack, no modern data engineering tools mentioned, on-premise infrastructure

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data stack, cloud platforms, or advanced data engineering practices mentioned

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined data engineering role focused on load research, economic analysis, and regulatory compliance

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, clear role definition, but concerns about low compensation and limited growth opportunities

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Explicitly reports to Manager of Load Research & Data Analytics

manager_level_inferred.evidence: Reports to Manager of Load Research & Data Analytics

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Mature utility company with stable operations, no growth signals mentioned

reporting_structure.evidence: Reports to Manager of Load Research & Data Analytics

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions working with cross-functional teams and acting as liaison between Department and Information Technology

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgency indicators like immediate start or ASAP mentioned

competition_level.evidence: Onsite role in El Paso, TX with utility industry focus limits candidate pool significantly

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Mature utility company serving 460,000 customers, established operations in Texas and New Mexico

hiring_velocity.evidence: Entry-level role suggests backfill or replacement hire rather than expansion

strength_details: Stable utility company with 460,000 customers and established operations
Entry-level opportunity (0-3 years) with clear growth path in data engineering
Well-defined role focused on economic research and regulatory compliance
concern_details: Salary range significantly below market rate for data engineering roles
No learning budget, mentorship, or career advancement opportunities mentioned
Traditional tech stack (PowerBI, SQL) with no modern data engineering tools
Onsite requirement in El Paso, TX limits flexibility and candidate pool
No visa sponsorship mentioned - work authorization required
best_fit_details: Junior data engineers (0-3 years) seeking stable utility industry role
Career changers from analytics/statistics backgrounds wanting to move into data engineering
Local El Paso candidates preferring onsite work in stable utility environment
probe_details: Ask about total compensation including benefits and potential for salary increases
Understand career progression opportunities within the Load Research department
Clarify current tech infrastructure and plans for modernization
Discuss typical work hours and any on-call or overtime expectations during regulatory deadlines
leverage_details: Being local to El Paso eliminates relocation costs and provides immediate availability
Background in utility industry, regulatory compliance, or economic analysis is valuable
summary.overall_assessment: Entry-level data engineering role at stable utility company with transparent compensation but below-market pay. Good for junior engineers or career changers seeking stable utility industry role. Limited growth opportunities and legacy technology stack are main trade-offs.
